revised_title: A Treatise on Rivers and Canals: Theoretical Principles and Applications
tldr: The author, Theod Aug. Mann, presents a treatise on rivers and canals, discussing their uses, types, and the laws of motion governing their waters. He explores the differences between artificial canals and rivers, and provides a comprehensive list of historical works on the subject. Mann's research aims to contribute to the understanding of water management and navigation, offering insights for the improvement of canals and rivers.
